listitem.para: ELLIPSEARC2 Moves the turtle clockwise over an elliptic arc. This arc will span angle degrees, starting at startangle degrees and ending at (startangle + angle) degrees.
The size of the ellipse is based on the crosswise.semiaxis and inline.semiaxis inputs.

The crosswise.semiaxis input is the distance from the center-point of the ellipse to the ellipse's edge along the crosswise axis. The inline.semiaxis input is the distance from the center-point of the ellipse to the ellipse's edge along the inline axis.
The actual orientation of the ellipse's axes relative to the turtle direction will depend on the chosen startangle.
The inline axis will start at 0 degrees and will end at 180 degrees; the crosswise axis will start at 90 degrees and will end at 270 degrees.
Normally, the turtle moves forward in a clockwise direction, but if the angle input is negative, then the turtle will move backward in a counter-clockwise direction.

FMSLogo computes the angles for the elliptic arc as if the arc had been traced on a circle and then stretched to fit on the ellipse's axes. This means that if you choose an angle that is not zero or a multiple of 90 degrees then the actual angle (from the beginning of the arc to the center of the ellipse) will be either smaller or larger when compared to the ellipse's axes in the final drawing; this will depend on the direction and amount of the ellipse's stretching. The same applies for the angle to the end of the elliptic arc.

programlisting.userinput: ; a 2D ellipse built out of multiple consecutive arcs SETPENSIZE 10 SETPENCOLOR "RED ELLIPSEARC2 90 150 100 0 SETPENCOLOR "LIME ELLIPSEARC2 90 150 100 90 SETPENCOLOR "BLUE ELLIPSEARC2 90 150 100 180 SETPENCOLOR "YELLOW ELLIPSEARC2 90 150 100 270
